8AC.F.summary: Amsterdam Commodities N.V., together with its subsidiaries, engages in sourcing, processing, treatment, trading, packaging, and distributing natural food products and ingredients for the food and beverage industry worldwide. The company operates in four segments: Spices and Nuts, Edible Seeds, Tea, and Food Ingredients. It offers tropical products, such as spices, coconut products, edible nuts, dried fruits, dehydrated vegetables, herbs, peanuts, shelled and unshelled nuts, kernels and seeds, chocolate-coated products, rice crackers, snack products, and fruit and vegetable chips. The company also sells confectionary sunflower seeds for the snack industry and retail chains; edible seeds, such as poppy seeds, sunflower seeds, sesame seeds, and pumpkin seeds; bakery ingredients, bird food ingredients, and special crops for the grain, seed, and pulse industries; Sunbutter, an alternative to peanut butter; and Sunnypaste, a substitute for nuts paste used in the confectionary and chocolate industry, as well as processes and distributes poppy seeds for the confection, spice, and bakery industries. In addition, it supplies tea to the private and public sectors; and produces and distributes food ingredients comprising meat tastes, yeast extracts, vegetable tastes, cheese tastes, spices and herbal blends, natural colorings, texturizers, sweeteners, and vegetarian Worchester sauce. Amsterdam Commodities N.V. was founded in 1856 and is based in Rotterdam, the Netherlands.
